snippet: The effect of Amar’e Stoudemire’s return to the starting lineup is one of many questions the Knicks face, while holding a two-game lead for the final playoff spot in the East.
abstract: New York Knicks hold a two-game lead for final playoff spot in the Eastern Conference, with eight games left in regular season; they have won six of nine games since losing forward Amar'e Stoudemire and point guard Jeremy Lin, muting doubts about their depth and fortitude.
lead_paragraph: The effect of Amar’e Stoudemire’s return to the starting lineup is one of many questions the Knicks face, while holding a two-game lead for the final playoff spot in the East.

headline.seo: For Knicks, Eight Games and Lots of Questions Remaining
headline.main: With Eight Games Left, Knicks Questions Abound
headline.print_headline: With Eight Games Left, Knicks Questions Abound
